article:
'Granzyme B' is a serine protease that in humans is encoded by the GZMB
gene. Granzyme B is expressed by cytotoxic T
lymphocytes (CTL) and natural killer (NK) cells.

 {{PBB Summary
| section_title = summary_text = CTL and NK cells share the remarkable ability
| to recognize specific infected target cells. They are thought to protect their
| host by inducing apoptosis of cells that bear on their surface 'nonself'
| antigens, usually peptides or proteins resulting from infection by
| intracellular pathogens. The protein encoded by this gene is crucial for the
| rapid induction of target cell apoptosis by CTL in cell-mediated immune
| response.
}}
